summary: Where the heck is the new teaser-trailer for Episode IX already?
body:
Where the heck is the new teaser-trailer for Episode IX already?

Some people said for sure the teaser would be posted in December…but no.

Now what? I have to wait for May or something?

I need some new footage; new material.. Need to know what Kylo looks like..

Come on now JJ.. Let us have a sneak peek.

reblog.comment:

Now what? I have to wait for May or something?

I need some new footage; new material.. Need to know what Kylo looks like..

Come on now JJ.. Let us have a sneak peek.

Come on now JJ.. Let us have a sneak peek.

summary: Is Korkie alive? And what happened with the New Mandalorians after 5x16? They were like “Ok, we tried.” and gave up? Shouldn’t...
body: Is Korkie alive? And what happened with the New Mandalorians after 5x16? They were like “Ok, we tried.” and gave up? Shouldn’t have Korkie taken the lead and at least try to get back the throne? I need answers!

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

question: Imagine living with Rey (Star Wars)
answer:
It wasn’t much. In fact, sometimes you thought it was barely anything, but most of the time you remember what you had. You had a home, and being with Rey was part of what made it a home. Living with Rey had been one of those things that you had done for a long time. In fact, you couldn’t really remember a time when the two of you hadn’t been living together.

It was nice, getting back home and hearing her tinkering away with things. Somehow, it was a calming noise despite how you always worried that eventually she was going to make something explode – and your home would be one of the things lost to it.

‘You’re back late,’ she said, not looking up from the thing that she was currently working on.

With a sigh, you sunk into one of the seats and closed your eyes, letting your weariness wash over you briefly. ‘Long shift,’ was all you said.

‘You know –’

‘Honestly, I’m good,’ you assured her, opening your eyes and looking towards her. You knew what she was going to say, that you could work with her, that the two of you would work better together than you would being stuck in a job you didn’t like. But you couldn’t. The money was good and the hours not always so terrible.

‘Can’t say I didn’t offer,’ she said, wiping her hands down her trousers as she stood up.

‘Would I?’ you asked, mocking hurt at the implication.

She raised an eyebrow at you but started heading towards the kitchen, taking your rations with her.

‘Thank you,’ you called, closing your eyes once more and resting your head carefully on the back of the chair.

‘You’re cooking tomorrow,’ she called, causing a small smirk to slip easily onto your face. ‘I don’t care what time you get in.’

‘So midnight snack of a dinner then?’ you countered, knowing that she was probably rolling her eyes as you spoke. You were just glad that the two of you had found somewhere to live, somewhere made even better by the fact that you got to live there together.

Icon from the Star Wars App.

title: Never Say Die
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2LREVpd

by CallMeHopeless (IAmNotBread)

The most embarrassing whimper cuts his throat: low and dark and desperately anxious. The plasticky smell almost seems eclipsed by a whole new curl of fragrances; too fast for you to comprehend. Spicy, delicious, intolerably strange. Synthetic and not. Laced with so many drugs that confusion rattles your gut.

“Alpha” he groans, squeezing his eyes shut as his breathing comes in thick and fast “please”.

blog.name: cyraniadebergerac
blog.title: Cyrania de Bergerac
blog.description: A random girl that reblogs whatever catches my fancy. When I do post, they tend to be AU and fanfic ideas if not some of my own writings or OCs. Fandoms range from SW to ST:TOS to Ace Atternoy to Professor Layton to RWBY to Undertale to BATIM with smatterings of KH and other fandoms. I generally keep my reblogs and post fun and non-lemony, but have occasional exceptions. Mostly in the serious department. Feel free to interact with me and my posts if you want.

title: Star Wars Mirror Verse
body:
So, something I’ve noticed a lack of in Star Wars lore is talk of what the mirror universe could be like. Which is honestly a bit surprising. Star Trek popularized the concept and Star Trek x Star Wars crossover ideas have been explored before as well as other possible aus, yet no full on mirror universe. Since I have thought about this a bit as a part of my personal headcanons, I thought I may as well jot some of them down here. I’m going to mash EU and canon together since EU basically encompasses canon with only some minor variations at this point (though I’m not going to really touch on the sequel series).

Overall Story (As Much as I’ve concretely come up with):

The major turning point for this au is the beginnings of the jedi/sith conflicts. For this universe, the Je’daii was the main order that slowly decided to delve more into the dark side and away from the light. The Sith precursor protested by holding onto the light side and rebelled against those that became the Jedi precursor that held to the dark side, leading to the schism that caused the Sith to flee to where they peaceably integrated into the Sith race and gained their name Sith. That in turn was the seeds of the Sith Republic. Across the way, the Jedi Order solidified and its conquest of those who would not respect its members lead to the creation of the Galactic Empire.

Similar wars came between the two of them, with the Sith Republic finally crumbling after the Jedi exterminated the Sith, believing that all had been killed with their records mostly destroyed. Instead, Master Bane (yes, darksiders keep the Darth, Lord, and Apprentice titles while the light siders keep the Master, Knight, and Padawan titles.) managed to survive with some records intact. He infiltrated the Empire and covertly taught padawans that could keep things secret while working with them and their padawans once they became knights to covertly encourage a revolution against the Empire. Years later, Master Palpatine would find himself surprisingly up pretty far in the political ladder (while he’d seen the politics as a necessary evil to help the future revolution and played them enough to be useful and stay alive, he’d not fully tried to angle his way up) with the Jedi completely unsuspecting in their arrogance. He was high enough, he realized, that he could start the pieces in motion for the master plan.

He was seeking to cover his shocked daze at reaching the highest office a non-Force user could reach and his grief for the felt death of his apprentice when he first met the Jedi’s “Chosen One” who would supposably hail a new age of power. What he observed was a nervous, scared young boy thrust into a situation that he was utterly unprepared for but had to survive. And his heart went out to this boy and he took the young Anakin Skywalker under his wing as much as possible, secretly nurturing the good that was within him while offering him tips for servicing based off of political experience. (He also secretly arranged for his mother’s freedom and safety before the Sith could seek to reach her to use against him.)

Meanwhile, he managed to do some good from his position while acting like a run of the mill politician. The Separatist Revolution commenced and the Sith ordered clone troopers to help fight against as cannon fodder against their droids. The Sith ordered the clones to come out brainwashed and the chip active to be relayed commands to. Palp discretely arranged for a simple fail safe that would allow the men to break free with a word. Timing was going to be everything.

(Someone better qualified could figure out how the Mirror Clone Wars would work. Palp being overjoyed that Maul survived would need to be part of it) 

The Clone Wars ended with a new Galactic Republic. Palp acted as temporary leader until he was elected and Ani was there beside him as his new padawan, helping the younglings he’d gotten out of the Jedi temple to understand that the system was going to be different now. That force sensitives could now learn how to use and control their power, but wouldn’t need to join the Sith Order unless they wanted to. The older Jedi who weren’t already dead were given chances to renounce being Jedi, leave others alone, or to leave, but those that proved themselves to enemies of the state were treated as such. The major crisis though that the Republic had to deal with was the leftover corruption from the Empire, which caused a lot to have a bad taste in their mouth. Which let former Imps and Jedi to create whispers after a while about how awful the Republic was and how an improved version of the Empire could make things better (not stated like that, but basically), fostering disent. 

(Thrawn comes onto the scene and can only reflect on how while the Empire makes more structural sense, there are so many deep scars left in the Republic from the Empire and he would be hanged before he willingly crushed an idealist like Palpatine who desperately wanted this to work and cared for his people and was instantly willing to ally with the Chiss and send them aid even if he had to bargain to give it for the sake of propriety and his people. People like Eli flourished here. Thrawn still went into the navy to learn about the Republic with Eli, though not required for the alliance. He learned tales from the clone veterans who choose to stick around to serve the new government that had officially granted them citizenship and helped them when someone disputed it, even giving them pay for their work. He swiftly advanced to Grand Admiral and the Chimera, where Eli remained his second in command as he first met and recruited Pellaeon. A remarkable, stubborn, down to earth man who’d somehow managed to keep some remnant of his being intact through service under multiple Jedi Lords that Thrawn was able to encourage back into flame [though there were often still times when Pell prepared for pain when questioning an order or delivering bad news or out of some blue that Thrawn was only starting to notice some pattern for ]. Thrawn definitely supports this Republic then and will do anything he can for the former Empire to not rise again.)


Thoughts? Questions? Comment please. I’d love to hear from you. Feel free to like and/or reblog as well if you like it and you could fit it.

Thoughts? Questions? Comment please. I’d love to hear from you. Feel free to like and/or reblog as well if you like it and you could fit it.
